questions.text: What grade are you currently in, and what's your ZIP code? This helps me find opportunities near you.
Where do you see yourself working? Choose what appeals to you most:
options: Outdoors - construction sites, farms, parks
Indoors - offices, hospitals, schools
Mixed - some indoor, some outdoor work
From home - remote or home-based work
Traveling - different locations regularly

questions.text: How do you prefer to work with your hands and tools?
options: Love working with tools and building things
Prefer working with people and helping them
Enjoy working with computers and technology
Like working with numbers and data
Prefer creative work like art or design

questions.text: When you face a problem, what's your natural approach?
options: Figure it out step-by-step with logical thinking
Ask others for help and work as a team
Research and study until I understand it
Try different solutions until something works
Use creativity to find a unique solution

questions.text: How important is helping others in your future career?
options: Very important - I want to directly help people
Somewhat important - helping is nice but not essential
Not important - I prefer working independently
Important indirectly - helping through my work/products
Unsure - I haven't thought about this much

questions.text: After high school, how much additional education or training are you willing to pursue?
options: Start working right away - minimal additional training
Short-term training (6 months to 1 year)
2-year community college degree
4-year college degree
Advanced degree (master's, professional school)

questions.text: How important is earning a high income to you?
options: Very important - I want to maximize my earning potential
Important - I want a comfortable living
Somewhat important - enough to meet my needs
Not very important - job satisfaction matters more
Unsure - I haven't thought about money much

questions.text: What type of work schedule and job security do you prefer?
options: Stable 9-5 job with regular hours
Flexible hours but steady work
Project-based work with variety
Seasonal work with time off
Entrepreneurial - start my own business

questions.text: Which school subjects do you find easiest or most enjoyable?
options: Math and numbers
Science (biology, chemistry, physics)
English and writing
History and social studies
Art and creative subjects
Physical education and health
Technology and computers
Foreign languages
Music
None of these appeal to me

questions.text: Tell me about your interests and what you're passionate about. What do you enjoy doing in your free time? What topics or activities make you excited to learn more? (Be as specific as possible - this helps me understand what careers might truly fulfill you)
questions.placeholder: Example: I love working on cars with my dad, I'm fascinated by how the human body works, I enjoy helping younger kids with their homework, I spend hours creating digital art...
